page.title: 01THE CLUNBURY BLOCK
page.content: This block is rural farming country in south Shropshire. There are three villages in the block and three hamlets, around the base of{Clunbury {Hill}which is a dominant feature of the centre of the block. The population is approximately two thousand people. It is an area becoming increasingly popular with retired people and many young people are leaving to seek employment elsewhere. There are only two primary schools in the block, one church and no chapels left in use. The church is part of a group ministry of five churches with one rector. The rivers of the{Clun}and{Kemp}flow west to east across the block, meeting to the north of Clunbury Hill. The area between the rivers was a marshy area but is now farmed. There are postal collections twice a day in the two main villages.
